paper.title: Short strings containing all k-element permutations

author.org: Department of Computer Science, Box 5972, North Carolina State University, Raleigh, NC 27650, USA#TAB#

paper.abstract: Given n and k, we consider the problem of constructing a shortest string over the set @S"n = {1, 2, ..., n} which contains every permutation of each k-element subset of @S"n as a subsequence. Let g(n, k) denote the length of a shortest such string. We show by construction that g(n, k) =u003c k(n - 2) + 4 for 3 =u003c k =u003c n.
